template.p: This setup is for hair salons providing hair-related services such as hair cutting, brushing, coloring, hair and scalp treatments, beard and mustache shaping.
A typical flow involves a client visiting the hair salon’s website to book an appointment. He selects from a variety of services:

ul.li: a color, an haircut & a brushing (3 hours)

template.p: & He then selects his preferred hairdresser according to the availability. &

During the service execution and depending on the client's needs and preferences, additional services such as conditioning, scalp massages, or other treatments may be offered. Those will be accounted for during the payment process using Point Of Sales (POS). Once the customer is ready to check out, the salon can also sell him haircare and styling products.
The salon also offers a loyalty program to reward loyal customers. &

div.a: Add additional services or products after the visit

ul.li: Pick the hairdresser you wish to meet
Schedule your visit by leaving your contact details

template.p: This will create an appointment in the hairdresser calendar. The customer contact details are automatically added. &
template.blockquote: Note: If the customer wishes to, he can reschedule or cancel his appointment later on. &
template.p: From the appointment app, manage easily the next appointments planned by going to Staff Schedule. &

Once the customer arrives in the Salon, click on his appointment then on "Confirm Check-in". It greens the appointment. If the appointment is not confirmed, the appointment becomes red once the time has passed.
template.blockquote: Note: You can also edit a planned appointment. From Staff Schedule, click on the relevant appointment then click on Edit. You can then modify the attendees, date, length, appointment type or simply delete it. Attendees will be informed by email. &
You can also create an appointment yourself by clicking on the + icon appearing while hovering a time slot.
template.p: Once the service has been executed, it's time for the customer to checkout and pay for it. &
From Point Of Sale (POS), open a new session and select the product variant that were used. &
template.blockquote: Note: Using products variants feature, you can give a single product (example: an haircut) different characteristics (hair length). On the product page, go to Attributes & Variants tab and specify the Attribute (Hair length) and the values it can take (short or long). By clicking on Configure, specify the extra price for each value.
template.p: In your salon, you use a loyalty program. It helps with &

ul.li: Retaining clients by rewarding their repeated visits
Boosting your revenue by encouraging clients to try more services and purchase products.
Setting apart from competitors and attracting both new and existing clients.

template.p: You offer a 20€ discount after 5 visits of 50€. In POS:

ul.li: Add the customer to your order in POS by clicking on "Customer".
If the order is above 50€, the points are automatically added to the customer’s account. After 5 visits, 20€ will be automatically discounted after clicking on Reward. &
In our example, select the customer 4 who has gained 5 points already and click on Reward.

template.blockquote: Note: You can create and configure several loyalty programs by going to POS > Products > Discount & Loyalty. The setting needs to be activated beforehand.
template.h3: Add additional services or products after the visit
template.p: During the visit, additional services were offered: a scalp treatment and some hair care. Add it to the order. &
The customer wishes to buy the shampoo that you used. Add the shampoo bottle to the order as well. &

ul.li: Click on Payment to confirm the order. &
You can print the receipt, email it to your customer, create an invoice or start a new order.
